members.member:
\ingroup Video_group
This class serves as the primary interface between the camera and the various features provided by the SDK.
It enables seamless integration and access to a wide array of capabilities, including video streaming, depth sensing, object tracking, mapping, and much more.

member.name: F:sl.Camera.sl_initParameters.openTimeoutSec
member.summary: Define a timeout in seconds after which an error is reported if the \ref open() command fails. Set to '-1' to try to open the camera endlessly without returning error in case of failure. Set to '0' to return error in case of failure at the first attempt. This parameter only impacts the LIVE mode.

member.name: F:sl.Camera.sl_initParameters.asyncGrabCameraRecovery
member.summary: Define the behavior of the automatic camera recovery during grab() function call. When async is enabled and there's an issue with the communication with the camera the grab() will exit after a short period and return the ERROR_CODE::CAMERA_REBOOTING warning.The recovery will run in the background until the correct communication is restored. When async_grab_camera_recovery is false, the grab() function is blocking and will return only once the camera communication is restored or the timeout is reached. The default behavior is synchronous (false), like previous ZED SDK versions

member.name: F:sl.Camera.sl_initParameters.grabComputeCappingFPS
member.summary: Define a computation upper limit to the grab frequency. This can be useful to get a known constant fixed rate or limit the computation load while keeping a short exposure time by setting a high camera capture framerate. The value should be inferior to the InitParameters::camera_fps and strictly positive.It has no effect when reading an SVO file. This is an upper limit and won't make a difference if the computation is slower than the desired compute capping fps. \note Internally the grab function always tries to get the latest available image while respecting the desired fps as much as possible.

member.name: F:sl.Camera.sl_initParameters.enableImageValidityCheck
member.summary: Enable or disable the image validity verification. This will perform additional verification on the image to identify corrupted data.This verification is done in the grab function and requires some computations. If an issue is found, the grab function will output a warning as sl.ERROR_CODE.CORRUPTED_FRAME. This version doesn't detect frame tearing currently. \n default: disabled

member.name: M:sl.Camera.Open(sl.InitParameters@)
member.summary:
Opens the ZED camera from the provided InitParameters.
The method will also check the hardware requirements and run a self-calibration.

members.member:
@name Video
Retrieves an image texture from the ZED SDK and loads it into a sl.Mat.
Use this to get an individual texture from the last grabbed frame in a human-viewable format. Image textures work for when you want the result to be visible, such as the direct RGB image from the camera, or a greyscale image of the depth. However it will lose accuracy if used to show measurements like depth or confidence, unlike measure textures. \note If you want to access the texture via script, you'll usually want to specify CPU memory. Then you can use Marshal.Copy to move them into a new byte array, which you can load into a Texture2D. Note that you may need to change the color space and/or flip the image.
\n\note For more info, read about the SDK method it calls: retrieveImage.
sl.Mat to fill with the new texture. Image type (left RGB, right depth map, etc.) Whether the image should be on CPU or GPU memory. Resolution of the texture. sl.ERROR_CODE indicating if the retrieval was successful, and why it wasn't otherwise.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetCameraTimeStamp
member.summary:
Gets the timestamp at the time the latest grabbed frame was extracted from the USB stream.
This is the closest timestamp you can get from when the image was taken. \note Must be called after calling Grab().
member.returns: Current timestamp in nanoseconds. -1 means it's is not available, such as with an .SVO file without compression.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetCurrentTimeStamp
member.summary:
Gets the current timestamp at the time the method is called.
Can be compared to the camera timestamp for synchronization, since they have the same reference (the computer's start time).
member.returns: The timestamp in nanoseconds.

member.param: The target timestamp for which the frame index is to be determined.
member.returns: The frame index within the SVO file that aligns with the given timestamp. Returns -1 if the timestamp falls outside the bounds of the SVO file.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.UpdateSelfCalibration
member.summary:
Perform a new self calibration process.
In some cases, due to temperature changes or strong vibrations, the stereo calibration becomes less accurate. \n Use this method to update the self-calibration data and get more reliable depth values. \note The self calibration will occur at the next \ref Grab() call. New values will then be available in \ref GetCameraInformation(), be sure to get them to still have consistent 2D - 3D conversion.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetFrameDroppedCount
member.summary:
Gets the number of frames dropped since Grab() was called for the first time.
It is based on camera timestamps and an FPS comparison. \note It is similar to the Frame Drop display in the ZED Explorer app.
member.returns: Frames dropped since first Grab() call.

members.member:
@{ @name Depth Sensing
Retrieves a measure texture from the ZED SDK and loads it into a sl.Mat.
Use this to get an individual texture from the last grabbed frame with measurements in every pixel - such as a depth map, confidence map, etc. Measure textures are not human-viewable but don't lose accuracy, unlike image textures. \note If you want to access the texture via script, you'll usually want to specify CPU memory. Then you can use Marshal.Copy to move them into a new byte array, which you can load into a Texture2D.
\n\note For more info, read about the SDK method it calls: retrieveMeasure.
sl.Mat to fill with the new texture. Measure type (depth, confidence, xyz, etc.). Whether the image should be on CPU or GPU memory. Resolution of the texture. sl.ERROR_CODE indicating if the retrieval was successful, and why it wasn't otherwise.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetConfidenceThreshold
member.summary:
Gets the current confidence threshold value for the disparity map (and by extension the depth map).
Values below the given threshold are removed from the depth map.
member.returns: Filtering value between 0 and 100.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetDepthMinRangeValue
member.summary: Gets the closest measurable distance by the camera, according to the camera type and depth map parameters.
member.returns: The nearest possible depth value.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetCurrentMixMaxDepth(System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Gets the current range of perceived depth.
member.param: Minimum depth detected (in selected sl.UNIT).
Maximum depth detected (in selected sl.UNIT).
member.returns: sl.ERROR_CODE.SUCCESS if values have been extracted. Other sl.ERROR_CODE otherwise.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetDepthMaxRangeValue
member.summary: Returns the current maximum distance of depth/disparity estimation.
member.returns: The closest depth

member.summary: Initializes and starts the positional tracking processes.
member.param: A structure containing all the specific parameters for the positional tracking. Default: a preset of PositionalTrackingParameters.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetCameraInformation(sl.Resolution)
member.summary:
Returns the CameraInformation associated the camera being used.
To ensure accurate calibration, it is possible to specify a custom resolution as a parameter when obtaining scaled information, as calibration parameters are resolution-dependent. \n When reading an SVO file, the parameters will correspond to the camera used for recording.
member.returns: CameraInformation containing the calibration parameters of the camera, as well as serial number and firmware version.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetPosition(System.Numerics.Quaternion@,System.Numerics.Vector3@,sl.REFERENCE_FRAME)
member.summary: Gets the position of the camera and the current state of the camera Tracking.
member.param: Quaternion filled with the current rotation of the camera depending on its reference frame.
Vector filled with the current position of the camera depending on its reference frame.
Reference frame for setting the rotation/position. REFERENCE_FRAME.CAMERA gives movement relative to the last pose. REFERENCE_FRAME.WORLD gives cumulative movements since tracking started.
member.returns: The current \ref POSITIONAL_TRACKING_STATE "state" of the tracking process.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetPositionalTrackingStatus
member.summary: Returns the current status of positional tracking module.
member.returns: The current status of positional tracking module.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetPosition(System.Numerics.Quaternion@,System.Numerics.Vector3@,System.Numerics.Quaternion@,System.Numerics.Vector3@,sl.REFERENCE_FRAME)
member.summary: Gets the current position of the camera and state of the tracking, with an optional offset to the tracking frame.
member.param: Quaternion filled with the current rotation of the camera depending on its reference frame.
Vector filled with the current position of the camera depending on its reference frame.
Rotational offset applied to the tracking frame.
Positional offset applied to the tracking frame.
Reference frame for setting the rotation/position. REFERENCE_FRAME.CAMERA gives movement relative to the last pose. REFERENCE_FRAME.WORLD gives cumulative movements since tracking started.
member.returns: The current \ref POSITIONAL_TRACKING_STATE "state" of the tracking process.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetPosition(System.Numerics.Quaternion@,System.Numerics.Vector3@,sl.TRACKING_FRAME,sl.REFERENCE_FRAME)
member.summary:
Gets the current position of the camera and state of the tracking, with a defined tracking frame.
A tracking frame defines what part of the camera is its center for tracking purposes. See sl.TRACKING_FRAME.
member.param: Quaternion filled with the current rotation of the camera depending on its reference frame.
Vector filled with the current position of the camera depending on its reference frame.
Center of the camera for tracking purposes (left eye, center, right eye).

member.summary: Defines a region of interest to focus on for all the SDK, discarding other parts.

Apply the ROI to a list of SDK module, all by default. Must of size sl.MODULE.LAST. The Mat defining the requested region of interest, pixels lower than 127 will be discarded from all modules: depth, positional tracking, etc. If empty, set all pixels as valid. The mask can be either at lower or higher resolution than the current images.
member.returns: An sl.ERROR_CODE if something went wrong.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetRegionOfInterest(sl.Mat,sl.Resolution,sl.MODULE)
member.summary: Get the previously set or computed region of interest.
member.param: The \ref Mat returned
The optional size of the returned mask
Specifies the module from which the ROI is to be obtained.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.StartRegionOfInterestAutoDetection(sl.RegionOfInterestParameters)
member.summary: Start the auto detection of a region of interest to focus on for all the SDK, discarding other parts. This detection is based on the general motion of the camera combined with the motion in the scene. The camera must move for this process, an internal motion detector is used, based on the Positional Tracking module. It requires a few hundreds frames of motion to compute the mask. \note This module is expecting a static portion, typically a fairly close vehicle hood at the bottom of the image. This module may not work correctly or detect incorrect background area, especially with slow motion, if there's no static element. This module work asynchronously, the status can be obtained using \ref GetRegionOfInterestAutoDetectionStatus(), the result is either auto applied, or can be retrieve using \ref GetRegionOfInterest function.
member.returns: An sl.ERROR_CODE if something went wrong.

member.name: M:sl.Camera.GetRegionOfInterestAutoDetectionStatus
member.summary: Return the status of the automatic Region of Interest Detection. The automatic Region of Interest Detection is enabled by using \ref StartRegionOfInterestAutoDetection
member.returns: An sl.ERROR_CODE if something went wrong.

members.member:
Extracts the current spatial map from the spatial mapping process.
If the object to be filled already contains a previous version of the mesh, only changes will be updated, optimizing performance.
sl.ERROR_CODE.SUCCESS if the mesh is filled and available, otherwise sl.ERROR_CODE.FAILURE. This is a blocking method. You should either call it in a thread or at the end of the mapping process.

members.member:
@{ @name Recording
Creates an SVO file to be filled by EnableRecording() and DisableRecording(). \note An SVO is Stereolabs' own format designed for the ZED. It holds the video feed with timestamps as well as info about the camera used to record it.
Filename of the recording. Whether it ends with .svo or .avi defines its file type. The compression to use for recording. Override default bitrate with a custom bitrate (Kbits/s). Use another fps than camera FPS. Must respect camera_fps%target_fps == 0. If input is in streaming mode, dump directly into SVO file (transcode=false) or decode/encode (transcode=true). An sl.ERROR_CODE that defines if the file was successfully created and can be filled with images.

\ingroup Core_group
List of error codes in the ZED SDK.
\note For more info, read about the ZED SDK C++ enum it mirrors: ERROR_CODE

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CORRUPTED_FRAME
member.summary: The image could be corrupted, Enabled with the parameter InitParameters.enable_image_validity_check

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_REBOOTING
member.summary: The camera is currently rebooting.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.SUCCESS
member.summary: Standard code for successful behavior.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.FAILURE
member.summary: Standard code for unsuccessful behavior.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.NO_GPU_COMPATIBLE
member.summary: No GPU found or CUDA capability of the device is not supported.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.NOT_ENOUGH_GPUMEM
member.summary: Not enough GPU memory for this depth mode. Try a different mode (such as \ref DEPTH_MODE "PERFORMANCE"), or increase the minimum depth value (see \ref InitParameters.depthMinimumDistance).

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_NOT_DETECTED
member.summary: No camera was detected.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.SENSORS_NOT_INITIALIZED
member.summary: The MCU that controls the sensors module has an invalid serial number. You can try to recover it by launching the ZED Diagnostic tool from the command line with the option -r.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.SENSOR_NOT_DETECTED
member.summary: A camera with sensor is detected but the sensors (IMU, barometer, ...) cannot be opened. Only the \ref MODEL "MODEL.ZED" does not has sensors. Unplug/replug is required.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_RESOLUTION
member.summary: In case of invalid resolution parameter, such as an upsize beyond the original image size in Camera.RetrieveImage.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.LOW_USB_BANDWIDTH
member.summary: Insufficient bandwidth for the correct use of the camera. This issue can occur when you use multiple cameras or a USB 2.0 port.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CALIBRATION_FILE_NOT_AVAILABLE
member.summary: The calibration file of the camera is not found on the host machine. Use ZED Explorer or ZED Calibration to download the factory calibration file.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_CALIBRATION_FILE
member.summary: The calibration file is not valid. Try to download the factory calibration file or recalibrate your camera using ZED Calibration.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_SVO_FILE
member.summary: The provided SVO file is not valid.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.SVO_RECORDING_ERROR
member.summary: An error occurred while trying to record an SVO (not enough free storage, invalid file, ...).

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.SVO_UNSUPPORTED_COMPRESSION
member.summary: An SVO related error, occurs when NVIDIA based compression cannot be loaded.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.END_OF_SVO_FILE_REACHED
member.summary: SVO end of file has been reached. \n No frame will be available until the SVO position is reset.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_COORDINATE_SYSTEM
member.summary: The requested coordinate system is not available.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_FIRMWARE
member.summary: The firmware of the camera is out of date. Update to the latest version.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_FUNCTION_PARAMETERS
member.summary: Invalid parameters have been given for the function.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CUDA_ERROR
member.summary: A CUDA error has been detected in the process, in Camera.Grab() or Camera.RetrieveXXX() only. Activate wrapperVerbose in ZEDManager.cs for more info.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_NOT_INITIALIZED
member.summary: The ZED SDK is not initialized. Probably a missing call to Camera.Open().

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.NVIDIA_DRIVER_OUT_OF_DATE
member.summary: Your NVIDIA driver is too old and not compatible with your current CUDA version.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_FUNCTION_CALL
member.summary: The call of the function is not valid in the current context. Could be a missing call of Camera.Open().

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CORRUPTED_SDK_INSTALLATION
member.summary: The ZED SDK was not able to load its dependencies or some assets are missing. Reinstall the ZED SDK or check for missing dependencies (cuDNN, TensorRT).

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INCOMPATIBLE_SDK_VERSION
member.summary: The installed ZED SDK is incompatible with the one used to compile the program.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INVALID_AREA_FILE
member.summary: The given area file does not exist. Check the path.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.INCOMPATIBLE_AREA_FILE
member.summary: The area file does not contain enough data to be used or the \ref DEPTH_MODE used during the creation of the area file is different from the one currently set.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_FAILED_TO_SETUP
member.summary: Failed to open the camera at the proper resolution. Try another resolution or make sure that the UVC driver is properly installed.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_DETECTION_ISSUE
member.summary: Your camera can not be opened. Try replugging it to another port or flipping the USB-C connector (if there is one).

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_ALREADY_IN_USE
member.summary: Cannot start the camera stream. Make sure your camera is not already used by another process or blocked by firewall or antivirus.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.NO_GPU_DETECTED
member.summary: No GPU found. CUDA is unable to list it. Can be a driver/reboot issue.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.PLANE_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: Plane not found. Either no plane is detected in the scene, at the location or corresponding to the floor, or the floor plane doesn't match the prior given.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.MODULE_NOT_COMPATIBLE_WITH_CAMERA
member.summary: The module you try to use is not compatible with your camera \ref MODEL. \note \ref MODEL "MODEL.ZED" does not has an IMU and does not support the AI modules.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.MOTION_SENSORS_REQUIRED
member.summary: The module needs the sensors to be enabled (see InitParameters.sensorsRequired).

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.MODULE_NOT_COMPATIBLE_WITH_CUDA_VERSION
member.summary: The module needs a newer version of CUDA.

member.name: F:sl.ERROR_CODE.SENSORS_DATA_REQUIRED
member.summary: The input data does not contains the high frequency sensors data, this is usually because it requires newer SVO/Streaming. In order to work this modules needs inertial data present in it input.

members.member:
\ingroup PositionalTracking_group
Class containing a set of parameters for the positional tracking module initialization.
The default constructor sets all parameters to their default settings. \note Parameters can be user adjusted.

member.name: F:sl.PositionalTrackingParameters.initialWorldRotation
member.summary: Rotation of the camera in the world frame when the camera is started.

member.name: F:sl.PositionalTrackingParameters.initialWorldPosition
member.summary: Position of the camera in the world frame when the camera is started.

members.member:
Whether the camera can remember its surroundings.
This helps correct positional tracking drift and can be helpful for positioning different cameras relative to one other in space. \warning This mode requires more resources to run, but greatly improves tracking accuracy. \warning We recommend leaving it on by default.

member.name: F:sl.PositionalTrackingParameters.enablePoseSmothing
member.summary: Whether to enable smooth pose correction for small drift correction.

members.member:
Initializes the tracking to be aligned with the floor plane to better position the camera in space.
\note This launches floor plane detection in the background until a suitable floor plane is found. \note The tracking will start in sl.POSITIONAL_TRACKING_STATE.SEARCHING state. \warning This features does not work with sl.MODEL.ZED since it needs an IMU to classify the floor. \warning The camera needs to look at the floor during initialization for optimum results.

Whether to define the camera as static.
If true, it will not move in the environment. This allows you to set its position using \ref initialWorldPosition and \ref initialWorldRotation. \n All ZED SDK functionalities requiring positional tracking will be enabled without additional computation. \n sl.Camera.GetPosition() will return the values set as \ref initialWorldPosition and \ref initialWorldRotation.

Whether to enable the IMU fusion.
When set to false, only the optical odometry will be used. \note This setting has no impact on the tracking of a camera. \note sl.MODEL.ZED does not have an IMU.

Minimum depth used by the ZED SDK for positional tracking.
It may be useful for example if any steady objects are in front of the camera and may perturb the positional tracking algorithm. \n Default: -1 (no minimum depth)

Whether to override 2 of the 3 components from \ref initialWorldRotation using the IMU gravity.
\note This parameter does nothing on sl.ZED.MODEL since it does not have an IMU.

Path of an area localization file that describes the surroundings (saved from a previous tracking session).
\note Loading an area file will start a search phase, during which the camera will try to position itself in the previously learned area. \warning The area file describes a specific location. If you are using an area file describing a different location, the tracking function will continuously search for a position and may not find a correct one. \warning The '.area' file can only be used with the same depth mode (sl.DEPTH_MODE) as the one used during area recording.

Positional tracking mode used.
Can be used to improve accuracy in some types of scene at the cost of longer runtime.

\ingroup PositionalTracking_group
Structure containing positional tracking data giving the position and orientation of the camera in 3D space.
Different representations of position and orientation can be retrieved, along with timestamp and pose confidence.

Whether the tracking is activated or not.
\note You should check that first if something is wrong.

Timestamp of the sl.Pose.
This timestamp should be compared with the camera timestamp for synchronization.

member.name: F:sl.Pose.rotation
member.summary: Orientation component of the sl.Pose.

member.name: F:sl.Pose.translation
member.summary: Translation component of the sl.Pose.

members.member:
Confidence/quality of the pose estimation for the target frame.
A confidence metric of the tracking [0-100] with: - 0: tracking is lost - 100: tracking can be fully trusted

member.name: F:sl.Pose.pose_covariance
member.summary: 6x6 pose covariance matrix of translation (the first 3 values) and rotation in so3 (the last 3 values).

members.member:
Twist of the camera available in reference camera.
This expresses velocity in free space, broken into its linear and angular parts.

Row-major representation of the 6x6 twist covariance matrix of the camera.
This expresses the uncertainty of the twist.

Angular velocity vector of the gyroscope in deg/s.
The value is corrected from bias, scale and misalignment. \note The value can be directly ingested in an IMU fusion algorithm to extract a quaternion. \note Not available in SVO or STREAM mode.

If the value is 1, the data has been taken during the same time than a frame has been acquired by the left sensor (the time precision is linked to the IMU rate, therefore 800Hz == 1.3ms). \n If the value is 0, the data has not been taken during a frame acquisition.

\ingroup Depth_group
Class containing parameters that defines the behavior of sl.Camera.Grab().
The default constructor sets all parameters to their default settings. \note Parameters can be user-adjusted at runtime.

Reference frame in which to provides the 3D measures (point cloud, normals, etc.).
Default: sl.REFERENCE_FRAME.CAMERA

Defines if the depth map should be computed.
Default: true \note If set to false, only the images are available.

Defines if the depth map should be completed or not.
Default: false \note It is similar to the removed sl.SENSING_MODE.FILL. \warning Enabling this will override the confidence values \ref confidenceThreshold and \ref textureConfidenceThreshold as well as \ref removeSaturatedAreas.

Threshold to reject depth values based on their confidence.
Each depth pixel has a corresponding confidence sl.MEASURE.CONFIDENCE in the range [1, 100]. 
 Decreasing this value will remove depth data from both objects edges and low textured areas, to keep only confident depth estimation data. 
 Default: 95 
ote Pixels with a value close to 100 are not to be trusted. Accurate depth pixels tends to be closer to lower values. 
ote It can be seen as a probability of error, scaled to 100.

Threshold to reject depth values based on their texture confidence.
The texture confidence range is [1, 100]. 
 Decreasing this value will remove depth data from image areas which are uniform. 
 Default: 100 (no depth pixel will be rejected) 
ote Pixels with a value close to 100 are not to be trusted. Accurate depth pixels tends to be closer to lower values.

Defines if the saturated area (luminance>=255) must be removed from depth map estimation.
Default: true \note It is recommended to keep this parameter at true because saturated area can create false detection.

Default constructor.
All the parameters are set to their default values.

\ingroup Depth_group
Structure containing intrinsic and extrinsic parameters of the camera (translation and rotation).
That information about the camera will be returned by sl.Camera.GetCameraInformation(). 
ote The calibration/rectification process, called during sl.Camera.Open(), is using the raw parameters defined in the SNXXX.conf file, where XXX is the serial number of the camera. 
ote Those values may be adjusted or not by the self-calibration to get a proper image alignment. 
ote After sl.Camera.Open() is done (with or without self-calibration activated), most of the stereo parameters (except baseline of course) should be 0 or very close to 0. 
ote It means that images after rectification process (given by sl.Camera.RetrieveImage()) are aligned as if they were taken by a "perfect" stereo camera, defined by the new sl.CalibrationParameters. \warning CalibrationParameters are returned in sl.COORDINATE_SYSTEM.IMAGE, they are not impacted by the sl.InitParameters.coordinateSystem. 
ote For more info, read about the ZED SDK C++ struct it mirrors: CalibrationParameters

members.member:
\ingroup Video_group
Class containing the options used to initialize the sl.Camera object.
This class allows you to select multiple parameters for the sl.Camera such as the selected camera, resolution, depth mode, coordinate system, and units of measurement. \n Once filled with the desired options, it should be passed to the sl.Camera.Open() method. \note For more info, read about the ZED SDK C++ class it mirrors: InitParameters

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.inputType
member.summary:
Defines the input source to initialize and open an sl.Camera object from.
The SDK can handle different input types: - Select a camera by its ID (/dev/videoX on Linux, and 0 to N cameras connected on Windows) - Select a camera by its serial number - Open a recorded sequence in the SVO file format - Open a streaming camera from its IP address and port
\note Available cameras and their id/serial number can be listed using sl.Camera.GetDeviceList() and sl.Camera.GetStreamingDeviceList(). \note Each sl.Camera will create its own memory (CPU and GPU), therefore the number of cameras used at the same time can be limited by the configuration of your computer (GPU/CPU memory and capabilities).
Default : (empty) \note See sl.InputType for complementary information.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.resolution
member.summary:
Desired camera resolution. \note Small resolutions offer higher framerate and lower computation time. \note In most situations, sl.RESOLUTION.HD720 at 60 FPS is the best balance between image quality and framerate.
Default:
ZED X/X Mini: sl.RESOLUTION.HD1200
other cameras: sl.RESOLUTION.HD720 \note Available resolutions are listed here: sl.RESOLUTION.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.cameraFPS
member.summary:
Requested camera frame rate.
If set to 0, the highest FPS of the specified ef camera_resolution will be used. 
 Default: 0 

 See sl.RESOLUTION for a list of supported frame rates. 
ote If the requested ef cameraFPS is unsupported, the closest available FPS will be used.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.cameraDeviceID
member.summary: Id for identifying which camera to use from the connected cameras.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.pathSVO
member.summary: Path to a recorded SVO file to play, including filename.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.svoRealTimeMode
member.summary:
Defines if sl.Camera object return the frame in real time mode.
When playing back an SVO file, each call to sl.Camera.Grab() will extract a new frame and use it. 
 However, it ignores the real capture rate of the images saved in the SVO file. 
 Enabling this parameter will bring the SDK closer to a real simulation when playing back a file by using the images' timestamps. 
 Default: false 
ote sl.Camera.Grab() will return an error when trying to play too fast, and frames will be dropped when playing too slowly.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.coordinateUnits
member.summary:
Unit of spatial data (depth, point cloud, tracking, mesh, etc.) for retrieval.
Default: sl.UNIT.MILLIMETER

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.coordinateSystem
member.summary:
sl.COORDINATE_SYSTEM to be used as reference for positional tracking, mesh, point clouds, etc.
This parameter allows you to select the sl.COORDINATE_SYSTEM used by the sl.Camera object to return its measures. \n This defines the order and the direction of the axis of the coordinate system. \n Default: sl.COORDINATE_SYSTEM.IMAGE

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.depthMode
member.summary:
sl.DEPTH_MODE to be used.
The ZED SDK offers several sl.DEPTH_MODE, offering various levels of performance and accuracy. 
 This parameter allows you to set the sl.DEPTH_MODE that best matches your needs. 
 Default: ef DEPTH_MODE "sl.DEPTH_MODE.PERFORMANCE" 
ote Available depth mode are listed here: sl.DEPTH_MODE.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.depthMinimumDistance
member.summary:
Minimum depth distance to be returned, measured in the sl.UNIT defined in ef coordinateUnits.
This parameter allows you to specify the minimum depth value (from the camera) that will be computed.

 In stereovision (the depth technology used by the camera), looking for closer depth values can have a slight impact on performance and memory consumption. 
 On most of modern GPUs, performance impact will be low. However, the impact of memory footprint will be visible. 
 In cases of limited computation power, increasing this value can provide better performance. 
 Default: -1 (corresponding values are available here) 
ote ef depthMinimumDistance value cannot be greater than 3 meters. 
ote 0 will imply that ef depthMinimumDistance is set to the minimum depth possible for each camera (those values are available here).

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.depthMaximumDistance
member.summary:
Maximum depth distance to be returned, measured in the sl.UNIT defined in \ref coordinateUnits.
When estimating the depth, the ZED SDK uses this upper limit to turn higher values into inf ones. \note Changing this value has no impact on performance and doesn't affect the positional tracking nor the spatial mapping. \note It only change values the depth, point cloud and normals.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.cameraImageFlip
member.summary:
Defines if a flip of the images is needed.
If you are using the camera upside down, setting this parameter to sl.FLIP_MODE.ON will cancel its rotation. 
 The images will be horizontally flipped. 
 Default: sl.FLIP_MODE.AUTO 
ote From ZED SDK 3.2 a new sl.FLIP_MODE enum was introduced to add the automatic flip mode detection based on the IMU gravity detection. 
ote This does not work on sl.MODEL.ZED cameras since they do not have the necessary sensors.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.enableRightSideMeasure
member.summary:
Enable the measurement computation on the right images.
By default, the ZED SDK only computes a single depth map, aligned with the left camera image. 
 This parameter allows you to enable sl.MEASURE.DEPTH_RIGHT and other ef MEASURE "sl.MEASURE.XXX_RIGHT" at the cost of additional computation time. 
 For example, mixed reality pass-through applications require one depth map per eye, so this parameter can be activated. 
 Default: False

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.cameraDisableSelfCalib
member.summary:
Disables the self-calibration process at camera opening.
At initialization, sl.Camera runs a self-calibration process that corrects small offsets from the device's factory calibration. 
 A drawback is that calibration parameters will slightly change from one (live) run to another, which can be an issue for repeatability. 
 If set to true, self-calibration will be disabled and calibration parameters won't be optimized, raw calibration parameters from the configuration file will be used. 
 Default: false 
ote In most situations, self calibration should remain enabled. 
ote You can also trigger the self-calibration at anytime after sl.Camera.Open() by calling sl.Camera.UpdateSelfCalibration(), even if this parameter is set to true.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.sdkVerbose
member.summary:
Enable the ZED SDK verbose mode.
This parameter allows you to enable the verbosity of the ZED SDK to get a variety of runtime information in the console. 
 When developing an application, enabling verbose (ef sdkVerbose >= 1) mode can help you understand the current ZED SDK behavior. 
 However, this might not be desirable in a shipped version. 
 Default: 0 (no verbose message) 
ote The verbose messages can also be exported into a log file. 
ote See ef sdkVerboseLogFile for more.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.sdkGPUId
member.summary:
NVIDIA graphics card id to use.
By default the SDK will use the most powerful NVIDIA graphics card found. 
 However, when running several applications, or using several cameras at the same time, splitting the load over available GPUs can be useful. 
 This parameter allows you to select the GPU used by the sl.Camera using an ID from 0 to n-1 GPUs in your PC. 
 Default: -1 
ote A non-positive value will search for all CUDA capable devices and select the most powerful.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.sdkVerboseLogFile
member.summary:
File path to store the ZED SDK logs (if ef sdkVerbose is enabled).
The file will be created if it does not exist. 
 Default: ""

ote Setting this parameter to any value will redirect all standard output print calls of the entire program. 
ote This means that your own standard output print calls will be redirected to the log file. 
ote This parameter can be particularly useful for creating a log system, and with Unreal or Unity applications that don't provide a standard console output. \warning The log file won't be cleared after successive executions of the application. \warning This means that it can grow indefinitely if not cleared.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.depthStabilization
member.summary:
Defines whether the depth needs to be stabilized and to what extent.
Regions of generated depth map can oscillate from one frame to another. 
 These oscillations result from a lack of texture (too homogeneous) on an object and by image noise. 
 This parameter controls a stabilization filter that reduces these oscillations. 
 In the range [0-100]:
0 disable the depth stabilization (raw depth will be return)
stabilization smoothness is linear from 1 to 100 Default: 1 
ote The stabilization uses the positional tracking to increase its accuracy, so the positional tracking module will be enabled automatically when set to a value different from 0. 
ote Note that calling sl.Camera.EnablePositionalTracking() with your own parameters afterwards is still possible.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.sensorsRequired
member.summary:
Requires the successful opening of the motion sensors before opening the camera.
Default: false.

ote If set to false, the ZED SDK will try to open and use the IMU (second USB device on USB2.0) and will open the camera successfully even if the sensors failed to open.
This can be used for example when using a USB3.0 only extension cable (some fiber extension for example). 
ote This parameter only impacts the LIVE mode. 
ote If set to true, sl.Camera.Open() will fail if the sensors cannot be opened. 
ote This parameter should be used when the IMU data must be available, such as object detection module or when the gravity is needed.


ote This setting is not taken into account for ef sl.MODEL.ZED camera since it does not include sensors.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.ipStream
member.summary: IP address of the streaming sender to connect to.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.portStream
member.summary: Port of the streaming sender to connect to.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.enableImageEnhancement
member.summary:
Enable the Enhanced Contrast Technology, to improve image quality.
Default: True.
\n If set to true, image enhancement will be activated in camera ISP. Otherwise, the image will not be enhanced by the IPS. \note This only works for firmware version starting from 1523 and up.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.optionalOpencvCalibrationFile
member.summary:
Optional path where the ZED SDK can find a file containing the calibration information of the camera computed by OpenCV.

ote Using this will disable the factory calibration of the camera. 
ote The file must be in a XML/YAML/JSON formatting provided by OpenCV. 
ote It also must contain the following keys: Size, K_LEFT (intrinsic left), K_RIGHT (intrinsic right), D_LEFT (distortion left), D_RIGHT (distortion right), R (extrinsic rotation), T (extrinsic translation). \warning Erroneous calibration values can lead to poor accuracy in all ZED SDK modules.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.openTimeoutSec
member.summary:
Define a timeout in seconds after which an error is reported if the sl.Camera.Open() method fails.
Set to '-1' to try to open the camera endlessly without returning error in case of failure. 
 Set to '0' to return error in case of failure at the first attempt. 
 Default: 5.0 
ote This parameter only impacts the LIVE mode.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.asyncGrabCameraRecovery
member.summary:
Define the behavior of the automatic camera recovery during sl.Camera.Grab() method call.
When async is enabled and there's an issue with the communication with the sl.Camera object, sl.Camera.Grab() will exit after a short period and return the ef ERROR_CODE "sl.ERROR_CODE.CAMERA_REBOOTING" warning. 
 The recovery will run in the background until the correct communication is restored. 
 When ef asyncGrabCameraRecovery is false, the sl.Camera.Grab() method is blocking and will return only once the camera communication is restored or the timeout is reached. 
 Default: false

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.grabComputeCappingFPS
member.summary:
Define a computation upper limit to the grab frequency.
This can be useful to get a known constant fixed rate or limit the computation load while keeping a short exposure time by setting a high camera capture framerate. 
 The value should be inferior to the sl.InitParameters.camera_fps and strictly positive. 
ote It has no effect when reading an SVO file.
This is an upper limit and won't make a difference if the computation is slower than the desired compute capping FPS. 
ote Internally the sl.Camera.grab() method always tries to get the latest available image while respecting the desired FPS as much as possible.

member.name: F:sl.InitParameters.enableImageValidityCheck
member.summary: Enable or disable the image validity verification. This will perform additional verification on the image to identify corrupted data.This verification is done in the grab function and requires some computations. If an issue is found, the grab function will output a warning as sl.ERROR_CODE.CORRUPTED_FRAME. This version doesn't detect frame tearing currently. \n default: disabled

\ingroup Video_group
Structure containing the options used to record. \note For more info, read about the ZED SDK C++ class it mirrors: RecordingParameters

member.name: F:sl.RecordingParameters.videoFilename
member.summary: Filename of the file to save the recording into.

member.name: F:sl.RecordingParameters.compressionMode
member.summary:
Compression mode the recording.
Default: sl.SVO_COMPRESSION_MODE.H264_BASED

member.name: F:sl.RecordingParameters.targetFPS
member.summary:
Framerate for the recording file.
Default: 0 (camera framerate will be taken) \warning This framerate must be below or equal to the camera framerate and camera framerate must be a multiple of the target framerate. \warning It means that it must respect cameraFPS%targetFPS == 0. \warning Allowed framerates are 15,30, 60 or 100 if possible. \warning Any other values will be discarded and camera FPS will be taken.

member.name: F:sl.RecordingParameters.bitrate
member.summary:
Overrides the default bitrate of the SVO file, in kbits/s.
Default: 0 (the default values associated with the resolution) \note Only works if \ref compressionMode is sl.SVO_COMPRESSION_MODE.H264_BASED or sl.SVO_COMPRESSION_MODE.H265_BASED. \note Available range: 0 or [1000 - 60000]

member.name: F:sl.RecordingParameters.transcode
member.summary:
Defines whether to decode and re-encode a streaming source.
Default: false 
ote If set to false, it will avoid decoding/re-encoding and convert directly streaming input into a SVO file. 
ote This saves a encoding session and can be especially useful on NVIDIA Geforce cards where the number of encoding session is limited. 
ote ef compressionMode, ef targetFPS and ef bitrate will be ignored in this mode.

member.name: M:sl.RecordingParameters.#ctor(System.String,sl.SVO_COMPRESSION_MODE,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Default constructor.
All the parameters are set to their default values.

members.member:
\ingroup Video_group
Structure containing the options used to stream with the ZED SDK. \note For more info, read about the ZED SDK C++ class it mirrors: StreamingParameters

member.name: F:sl.StreamingParameters.codec
member.summary: Encoding used for streaming.

member.name: F:sl.StreamingParameters.port
member.summary: Port used for streaming. \warning Port must be an even number. Any odd number will be rejected. \warning Port must be opened.

member.name: F:sl.StreamingParameters.bitrate
member.summary: Defines the streaming bitrate in Kbits/s. | sl.STREAMING_CODEC | sl.RESOLUTION | FPS | Bitrate (kbps) | |------------------|--------------|-------|----------------| | H264 | HD2K | 15 | 8500 | | H264 | HD1080 | 30 | 12500 | | H264 | HD720 | 60 | 7000 | | H265 | HD2K | 15 | 7000 | | H265 | HD1080 | 30 | 11000 | | H265 | HD720 | 60 | 6000 | Default: 0 (it will be set to the best value depending on your resolution/FPS) \note Available range: [1000 - 60000]

member.name: F:sl.StreamingParameters.adaptativeBitrate
member.summary:
Defines whether the adaptive bitrate is enable.
Default: false \note Bitrate will be adjusted depending the number of packet dropped during streaming. \note If activated, the bitrate can vary between [bitrate/4, bitrate]. \warning Currently, the adaptive bitrate only works when "sending" device is a NVIDIA Jetson (X1, X2, Xavier, Nano).

member.name: F:sl.StreamingParameters.chunkSize
member.summary:
Size of a single chunk.
Default: 16084 
ote Stream buffers are divided into X number of chunks where each chunk is ef chunkSize bytes long. 
ote You can lower ef chunkSize value if network generates a lot of packet lost: this will generates more chunk for a single image, but each chunk sent will be lighter to avoid inside-chunk corruption. 
ote Increasing this value can decrease latency.

 
ote Available range: [1024 - 65000]

member.name: F:sl.StreamingParameters.targetFPS
member.summary:
Framerate for the streaming output.
Default: 0 (camera framerate will be taken) \warning This framerate must be below or equal to the camera framerate. \warning Allowed framerates are 15, 30, 60 or 100 if possible. \warning Any other values will be discarded and camera FPS will be taken.

member.name: M:sl.StreamingParameters.#ctor(sl.STREAMING_CODEC,System.UInt16,System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.UInt16,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Default constructor.
All the parameters are set to their default values.

\ingroup Video_group
Lists available camera settings for the camera (contrast, hue, saturation, gain, ...). \warning GAIN and EXPOSURE are linked in auto/default mode (see \ref sl.Camera.SetCameraSettings()).

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.BRIGHTNESS
member.summary: Brightness control. \n Affected value should be between 0 and 8. \note Not available for ZED X/X Mini cameras.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.CONTRAST
member.summary: Contrast control \n Affected value should be between 0 and 8. \note Not available for ZED X/X Mini cameras.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.HUE
member.summary: Hue control \n Affected value should be between 0 and 11. \note Not available for ZED X/X Mini cameras.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.SATURATION
member.summary: Saturation control \n Affected value should be between 0 and 8.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.SHARPNESS
member.summary: Digital sharpening control \n Affected value should be between 0 and 8.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.GAMMA
member.summary: ISP gamma control \n Affected value should be between 1 and 9.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.GAIN
member.summary: Gain control \n Affected value should be between 0 and 100 for manual control. \note If EXPOSURE is set to -1 (automatic mode), then \ref VIDEO_SETTINGS.GAIN "GAIN" will be automatic as well.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.EXPOSURE
member.summary:
Exposure control \n Affected value should be between 0 and 100 for manual control. \n The exposition is mapped linearly in a percentage of the following max values. \n Special case for EXPOSURE = 0 that corresponds to 0.17072ms. \n The conversion to milliseconds depends on the framerate:
15fps EXPOSURE = 100 -> 19.97ms
30fps EXPOSURE = 100 -> 19.97ms
60fps EXPOSURE = 100 -> 10.84072ms
100fps EXPOSURE = 100 -> 10.106624ms

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.AEC_AGC
member.summary: Defines if the \ref VIDEO_SETTINGS.GAIN "GAIN" and \ref VIDEO_SETTINGS.EXPOSURE "EXPOSURE" are in automatic mode or not. \n Setting \ref VIDEO_SETTINGS.GAIN "GAIN" or \ref VIDEO_SETTINGS.EXPOSURE "EXPOSURE" values will automatically set this value to 0.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.AEC_AGC_ROI
member.summary: Defines the region of interest for automatic exposure/gain computation. \n To be used with overloaded \ref Camera.SetCameraSettings(VIDEO_SETTINGS,SIDE,Rect,bool) "SetCameraSettings()" / \ref Camera.GetCameraSettings(VIDEO_SETTINGS,SIDE,ref Rect) "GetCameraSettings()" methods.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.WHITEBALANCE_TEMPERATURE
member.summary: Color temperature control \n Affected value should be between 2800 and 6500 with a step of 100. \note Setting a value will automatically set \ref sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.WHITEBALANCE_AUTO "WHITEBALANCE_AUTO" to 0.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.WHITEBALANCE_AUTO
member.summary: Defines if the white balance is in automatic mode or not.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.LED_STATUS
member.summary:
Status of the front LED of the camera. 
 Set to 0 to disable the light, 1 to enable the light. 
 Default value is on. 
ote Requires camera firmware 1523 at least.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.EXPOSURE_TIME
member.summary: Real exposure time control in microseconds. \note Only available for ZED X/X Mini cameras. \note Replace \ref VIDEO_SETTINGS.EXPOSURE "EXPOSURE" setting.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.ANALOG_GAIN
member.summary:
Real analog gain (sensor) control in mDB. 
 The range is defined by Jetson DTS and by default [1000-16000]. 
ote Only available for ZED X/X Mini cameras. 
ote Replace ef VIDEO_SETTINGS.GAIN "GAIN" settings.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.DIGITAL_GAIN
member.summary:
Real digital gain (ISP) as a factor. 
 The range is defined by Jetson DTS and by default [1-256]. 
ote Only available for ZED X/X Mini cameras. 
ote Replace ef VIDEO_SETTINGS.GAIN "GAIN" settings.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.AUTO_ANALOG_GAIN_RANGE
member.summary:
Range of sensor gain in automatic control. 
 Used with ef Camera.SetCameraSettings(VIDEO_SETTINGS,int,int) "SetCameraSettings()". 
 Min/max range between max range defined in DTS. 
 By default: [1000 - 16000] mdB. 
ote Only available for ZED X/X Mini cameras.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.AUTO_DIGITAL_GAIN_RANGE
member.summary:
Range of digital ISP gain in automatic control. 
 Used with ef Camera.SetCameraSettings(VIDEO_SETTINGS,int,int) "SetCameraSettings()". 
 Min/max range between max range defined in DTS. 
 By default: [1 - 256]. 
ote Only available for ZED X/X Mini cameras.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.EXPOSURE_COMPENSATION
member.summary:
Exposure-target compensation made after auto exposure. 
 Reduces the overall illumination target by factor of F-stops. 
 Affected value should be between 0 and 100 (mapped between [-2.0,2.0]). 
 Default value is 50, i.e. no compensation applied. 
ote Only available for ZED X/X Mini cameras.

member.name: F:sl.VIDEO_SETTINGS.DENOISING
member.summary:
Level of denoising applied on both left and right images. 
 Affected value should be between 0 and 100. 
 Default value is 50. 
ote Only available for ZED X/X Mini cameras.

ote Requires a NVIDIA GPU.

The default constructor sets all parameters to their default settings. \note Parameters can be adjusted by the user.

Controls the spread of plane by checking the position difference.
Default: 0.15 meters

Controls the spread of plane by checking the angle difference.
Default: 15 degrees

\ingroup SpatialMapping_group
Class containing a set of parameters for the spatial mapping module.
The default constructor sets all parameters to their default settings. \note Parameters can be adjusted by the user.

member.name: F:sl.SpatialMappingParameters.resolutionMeter
member.summary: Spatial mapping resolution in meters.

members.member:
Depth range in meters.
Can be different from the value set by sl.InitParameters.depthMaximumDistance. \note Set to 0 by default. In this case, the range is computed from \ref resolutionMeter and from the current internal parameters to fit your application.

Whether to save the texture.
If set to true, you will be able to apply the texture to your mesh after it is created. \note This option will consume more memory. \note This option is only available for sl.SPATIAL_MAP_TYPE.MESH.

Whether to only use chunks.
If set to false, you will ensure consistency between the mesh and its inner chunk data. \note Updating the mesh is time-consuming. \note Setting this to true results in better performance.

member.name: F:sl.SpatialMappingParameters.maxMemoryUsage
member.summary: The maximum CPU memory (in MB) allocated for the meshing process.

members.member:
Whether to inverse the order of the vertices of the triangles.
If your display process does not handle front and back face culling, you can use this to correct it. \note This option is only available for sl.SPATIAL_MAP_TYPE.MESH.

member.name: F:sl.SpatialMappingParameters.map_type
member.summary: The type of spatial map to be created. This dictates the format that will be used for the mapping(e.g. mesh, point cloud). See \ref SPATIAL_MAP_TYPE

members.member:
Control the integration rate of the current depth into the mapping process.
This parameter controls how many times a stable 3D points should be seen before it is integrated into the spatial mapping. \n Default: 0 (this will define the stability counter based on the mesh resolution, the higher the resolution, the higher the stability counter)

Sets all parameters to their default and optimized values.

members.member:
\ingroup Object_group
Structure containing a set of parameters for batch object detection.
The default constructor sets all parameters to their default settings. \note Parameters can be user adjusted.

Whether to enable the batch option in the object detection module.
Batch queueing system provides: - deep-learning based re-identification - trajectory smoothing and filtering
Default: false \note To activate this option, \ref enable must be set to true.

Max retention time in seconds of a detected object.
After this time, the same object will mostly have a different id.

Trajectories will be output in batch with the desired latency in seconds.
During this waiting time, re-identification of objects is done in the background. \note Specifying a short latency will limit the search (falling in timeout) for previously seen object ids but will be closer to real time output. \note Specifying a long latency will reduce the change of timeout in re-identification but increase difference with live output.

members.member:
\ingroup Object_group
Structure containing a set of parameters for the object detection module.
The default constructor sets all parameters to their default settings. \note Parameters can be user adjusted.

Id of the module instance.
This is used to identify which object detection module instance is used.

Whether the object masks will be computed.
Default: false

sl.OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL to use.
Default: sl.OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL.MULTI_CLASS_BOX_FAST

Upper depth range for detections.
Default: -1 (value set in sl.InitParameters.depthMaximumDistance) \note The value cannot be greater than sl.InitParameters.depthMaximumDistance and its unit is defined in sl.InitParameters.coordinateUnits.

Batching system parameters.
Batching system (introduced in 3.5) performs short-term re-identification with deep-learning and trajectories filtering. \n sl.BatchParameters.enable must to be true to use this feature (by default disabled).

Filtering mode that should be applied to raw detections.
Default: sl.OBJECT_FILTERING_MODE.NMS3D (same behavior as previous ZED SDK version) 
ote This parameter is only used in detection model [sl.OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL.MULTI_CLASS_BOX_XXX](ef OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL) and sl.OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL.CUSTOM_BOX_OBJECTS. 
ote For custom object, it is recommended to use sl.OBJECT_FILTERING_MODE.NMS3D_PER_CLASS or sl.OBJECT_FILTERING_MODE.NONE. 
ote In this case, you might need to add your own NMS filter before ingesting the boxes into the object detection module.

Prediction duration of the ZED SDK when an object is not detected anymore before switching its state to sl.OBJECT_TRACKING_STATE.SEARCHING.
It prevents the jittering of the object state when there is a short misdetection. 
 The user can define their own prediction time duration. 
 Default: 0.2f 
ote During this time, the object will have sl.OBJECT_TRACKING_STATE.OK state even if it is not detected. 
ote The duration is expressed in seconds. \warning ef predictionTimeout_s will be clamped to 1 second as the prediction is getting worse with time. \warning Setting this parameter to 0 disables the ZED SDK predictions.

Whether to allow inference to run at a lower precision to improve runtime and memory usage.
It might increase the initial optimization time and could include downloading calibration data or calibration cache and slightly reduce the accuracy. 
ote The fp16 is automatically enabled if the GPU is compatible and provides a speed up of almost x2 and reduce memory usage by almost half, no precision loss. 
ote This setting allow int8 precision which can speed up by another x2 factor (compared to fp16, or x4 compared to fp32) and half the fp16 memory usage, however some accuracy could be lost. 
ote The accuracy loss should not exceed 1-2% on the compatible models. 
ote The current compatible models are all [sl.AI_MODELS.HUMAN_BODY_XXXX](ef AI_MODELS).

\ingroup Object_group
Structure containing a set of runtime parameters for the object detection module.
The default constructor sets all parameters to their default settings. \note Parameters can be adjusted by the user.

Confidence threshold.
From 1 to 100, with 1 meaning a low threshold, more uncertain objects and 99 very few but very precise objects. 
 Default: 20.f 
ote If the scene contains a lot of objects, increasing the confidence can slightly speed up the process, since every object instance is tracked. 
ote ef detectionConfidenceThreshold is used as a fallback when sl::ObjectDetectionRuntimeParameters.objectConfidenceThreshold is partially set.

Defines which object types to detect and track.
Default: ```new int[(int)sl.OBJECT_CLASS.LAST)]``` (all classes are tracked) \note Fewer object types can slightly speed up the process since every object is tracked. \note Will output only the selected classes.
In order to get all the available classes, the filter list must be empty : \code objectClassFilter = new int[(int)sl.OBJECT_CLASS.LAST)]; \endcode
To select a set of specific object classes, like vehicles, persons and animals for instance: \code objectClassFilter[(int)sl.OBJECT_CLASS.PERSON] = Convert.ToInt32(true); objectClassFilter[(int)sl.OBJECT_CLASS.VEHICLE] = Convert.ToInt32(true); objectClassFilter[(int)sl.OBJECT_CLASS.ANIMAL] = Convert.ToInt32(true); \endcode

Array of confidence thresholds for each class (can be empty for some classes).
\note sl::ObjectDetectionRuntimeParameters.detectionConfidenceThreshold will be taken as fallback/default value.

\ingroup Body_group
Structure containing a set of parameters for the body tracking module.
The default constructor sets all parameters to their default settings. \note Parameters can be user adjusted.

Id of the module instance.
This is used to identify which body tracking module instance is used.

Whether the body/person masks will be computed.
Default: false

sl.BODY_TRACKING_MODEL to use.
Default: sl.BODY_TRACKING_MODEL.HUMAN_BODY_ACCURATE

Whether to apply the body fitting.
Default: false

member.summary: Body format to be outputted by the ZED SDK with sl.Camera.RetrieveBodies().

Selection of keypoints to be outputted by the ZED SDK with \ref sl_retrieve_bodies().
Default: SL_BODY_KEYPOINTS_SELECTION_FULL

Upper depth range for detections.
Default: -1 (value set in sl.InitParameters.depthMaximumDistance) \note The value cannot be greater than sl.InitParameters.depthMaximumDistance and its unit is defined in sl.InitParameters.coordinateUnits.

Prediction duration of the ZED SDK when an object is not detected anymore before switching its state to sl.OBJECT_TRACKING_STATE.SEARCHING.
It prevents the jittering of the object state when there is a short misdetection. 
 The user can define their own prediction time duration. 
 Default: 0.2f 
ote During this time, the object will have sl.OBJECT_TRACKING_STATE.OK state even if it is not detected. 
ote The duration is expressed in seconds. \warning ef predictionTimeout_s will be clamped to 1 second as the prediction is getting worse with time. \warning Setting this parameter to 0 disables the ZED SDK predictions.

Whether to allow inference to run at a lower precision to improve runtime and memory usage.
It might increase the initial optimization time and could include downloading calibration data or calibration cache and slightly reduce the accuracy. 
ote The fp16 is automatically enabled if the GPU is compatible and provides a speed up of almost x2 and reduce memory usage by almost half, no precision loss. 
ote This setting allow int8 precision which can speed up by another x2 factor (compared to fp16, or x4 compared to fp32) and half the fp16 memory usage, however some accuracy could be lost. 
ote The accuracy loss should not exceed 1-2% on the compatible models. 
ote The current compatible models are all [sl.AI_MODELS.HUMAN_BODY_XXXX](ef AI_MODELS).

\ingroup Body_group
Structure containing a set of runtime parameters for the body tracking module.
The default constructor sets all parameters to their default settings. \note Parameters can be adjusted by the user.

Confidence threshold.
From 1 to 100, with 1 meaning a low threshold, more uncertain objects and 99 very few but very precise objects. \n Default: 20.f \note If the scene contains a lot of objects, increasing the confidence can slightly speed up the process, since every object instance is tracked.

Minimum threshold for the keypoints.
The ZED SDK will only output the keypoints of the skeletons with threshold greater than this value. \n Default: 0 \note It is useful, for example, to remove unstable fitting results when a skeleton is partially occluded.

Control of the smoothing of the fitted fused skeleton.
It is ranged from 0 (low smoothing) and 1 (high smoothing). \n Default: 0

\ingroup Object_group
Structure containing data of a detected object such as its \ref boundingBox, \ref label, \ref id and its 3D \ref position.

Object identification number.
It is used as a reference when tracking the object through the frames. \note Only available if sl.ObjectDetectionParameters.enableTracking is activated. \note Otherwise, it will be set to -1.

Unique id to help identify and track AI detections.
It can be either generated externally, or by using sl.Camera.GenerateUniqueID() or left empty.

Object raw label.
It is forwarded from sl.CustomBoxObjectData when using sl.OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL.CUSTOM_BOX_OBJECTS.

member.summary: Object class/category to identify the object type.

member.summary: Object sub-class/sub-category to identify the object type.

member.summary: Object tracking state.

members.member:
Object 3D centroid.
\note It is defined in sl.InitParameters.coordinateUnits and expressed in sl.RuntimeParameters.measure3DReferenceFrame.

Detection confidence value of the object.
From 0 to 100, a low value means the object might not be localized perfectly or the label (sl.OBJECT_CLASS) is uncertain.

Pointer of the sl.Mat representing the mask defining which pixels which belong to the object (in \ref boundingBox and set to 255) and those of the background (set to 0). To access the pixels values, create a new sl.Mat from that IntPtr. Ex: sl.Mat mat = new sl.Mat(mask);
\warning The mask information is only available for tracked objects (sl.OBJECT_TRACKING_STATE.OK) that have a valid depth. \warning Otherwise, the mask will not be initialized.

2D bounding box of the object represented as four 2D points starting at the top left corner and rotation clockwise.
\note Expressed in pixels on the original image resolution, ```[0, 0]``` is the top left corner. \code A ------ B | Object | D ------ C \endcode

3D centroid of the head of the object (a person).
\note It is defined in sl.InitParameters.coordinateUnits and expressed in sl.RuntimeParameters.measure3DReferenceFrame. \warning Not available with [sl.OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL.MULTI_CLASS_BOX_XXX](\ref OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL).

Object 3D velocity.
\note It is defined in ```sl.InitParameters.coordinateUnits / s``` and expressed in sl.RuntimeParameters.measure3DReferenceFrame.

3D object dimensions: width, height, length.
\note It is defined in sl.InitParameters.coordinateUnits and expressed in sl.RuntimeParameters.measure3DReferenceFrame.

3D bounding box of the object represented as eight 3D points.
\note It is defined in sl.InitParameters.coordinateUnits and expressed in sl.RuntimeParameters.measure3DReferenceFrame. \code 1 ------ 2 / /| 0 ------ 3 | | Object | 6 | |/ 4 ------ 7 \endcode

3D bounding box of the head of the object (a person) represented as eight 3D points.
\note It is defined in sl.InitParameters.coordinateUnits and expressed in sl.RuntimeParameters.measure3DReferenceFrame. \warning Not available with [sl.OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL.MULTI_CLASS_BOX_XXX](\ref OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL).

2D bounding box of the head of the object (a person) represented as four 2D points starting at the top left corner and rotation clockwise.
\note Expressed in pixels on the original image resolution, ```[0, 0]``` is the top left corner. \warning Not available with [sl.OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL.MULTI_CLASS_BOX_XXX](\ref OBJECT_DETECTION_MODEL).

Covariance matrix of the 3D position.
\note It is represented by its upper triangular matrix value \code = [p0, p1, p2] [p1, p3, p4] [p2, p4, p5] \endcode where pi is ```positionCovariance[i]```

\ingroup Object_group
Structure that store externally detected objects.
The objects can be ingested with sl.Camera.IngestCustomBoxObjects() to extract 3D and tracking information over time.

Unique id to help identify and track AI detections.
It can be either generated externally, or by using sl.Camera.GenerateUniqueID() or left empty.

2D bounding box of the object represented as four 2D points starting at the top left corner and rotation clockwise.
\note Expressed in pixels on the original image resolution, ```[0, 0]``` is the top left corner. \code A ------ B | Object | D ------ C \endcode

Object label.
This information is passed-through and can be used to improve object tracking. \note It should define an object class. This means that any similar object (in classification) should share the same label number.

Detection confidence value of the object.
\note The value should be in ```[0-1]```. \note It can be used to improve the object tracking.

Provide hypothesis about the object movements (degrees of freedom or DoF) to improve the object tracking.
- true: 2 DoF projected alongside the floor plane. Case for object standing on the ground such as person, vehicle, etc. 
 The projection implies that the objects cannot be superposed on multiple horizontal levels. - false: 6 DoF (full 3D movements are allowed).

ote This parameter cannot be changed for a given object tracking id. 
ote It is advised to set it by labels to avoid issues.

Number of detected objects.
\note You can use it to iterate through the \ref objectData array.

Timestamp corresponding to the frame acquisition.
This value is especially useful for the async mode to synchronize the data.

\note The orientation is represented by a quaternion. \warning Not available with sl.BODY_FORMAT.BODY_18.

The orientation is also represented by a quaternion. \note The global root position is already accessible in \ref keypoint attribute by using the root index of a given sl.BODY_FORMAT. \warning Not available with sl.BODY_FORMAT.BODY_18.

member.summary: Intra-process shared memory allocation issue. \n Multiple connections to the same data.

member.summary: Standard code for successful behavior.

member.summary: Significant differences observed between sender's FPS.

member.name: F:sl.FUSION_ERROR_CODE.FPS_TOO_LOW
member.summary: At least one sender has an FPS lower than 10 FPS.

member.summary: Problem detected with the ingested timestamp. \n Sample data will be ignored.

member.summary: Problem detected with the ingested covariance. \n Sample data will be ignored.

members.member:
\ingroup Fusion_group
Holds the options used for calibrating GNSS / VIO.

member.name: F:sl.GNSSCalibrationParameters.targetYawUncertainty
member.summary:
This parameter defines the target yaw uncertainty at which the calibration process between GNSS and VIO concludes. The unit of this parameter is in radian.
Default: 0.1 radians

member.name: F:sl.GNSSCalibrationParameters.enableTranslationUncertaintyTarget
member.summary:
When this parameter is enabled (set to true), the calibration process between GNSS and VIO accounts for the uncertainty in the determined translation, thereby facilitating the calibration termination. The maximum allowable uncertainty is controlled by the 'target_translation_uncertainty' parameter.
Default: false

member.name: F:sl.GNSSCalibrationParameters.targetTranslationUncertainty
member.summary:
This parameter defines the target translation uncertainty at which the calibration process between GNSS and VIO concludes.
Default: 10e-2 (10 centimeters)

member.name: F:sl.GNSSCalibrationParameters.enableReinitialization
member.summary:
This parameter determines whether reinitialization should be performed between GNSS and VIO fusion when a significant disparity is detected between GNSS data and the current fusion data. It becomes particularly crucial during prolonged GNSS signal loss scenarios.
Default: true

member.name: F:sl.GNSSCalibrationParameters.gnssVioReinitThreshold
member.summary:
This parameter determines the threshold for GNSS/VIO reinitialization. If the fused position deviates beyond out of the region defined by the product of the GNSS covariance and the gnss_vio_reinit_threshold, a reinitialization will be triggered.
Default: 5

member.name: F:sl.GNSSCalibrationParameters.enableRollingCalibration
member.summary:
If this parameter is set to true, the fusion algorithm will used a rough VIO / GNSS calibration at first and then refine it. This allow you to quickly get a fused position.
Default: true

member.name: F:sl.GNSSCalibrationParameters.gnssAntennaPosition
member.summary: Define a transform between the GNSS antenna and the camera system for the VIO / GNSS calibration. Default value is [0,0,0], this position can be refined by the calibration if enabled

\ingroup Core_group
Class representing 1 to 4-channel matrix of float or uchar, stored on CPU and/or GPU side.
This class is defined in a row-major order, meaning that for an image buffer, the rows are stored consecutively from top to bottom. \note For more info, read about the ZED SDK C++ class it mirrors: Mat

members.member:
\ingroup Fusion_group
Holds Fusion process data and functions

member.name: F:sl.Fusion.nameDll
member.summary: DLL name, used for extern calls to the wrapper.

member.name: T:sl.Fusion.sl_GNSSCalibrationParameters
member.summary: DLL-friendly version of GNSSCalibrationParameters (found in ZEDCommon.cs).

member.name: F:sl.Fusion.sl_GNSSCalibrationParameters.targetYawUncertainty
member.summary: This parameter defines the target yaw uncertainty at which the calibration process between GNSS and VIO concludes. The unit of this parameter is in radian. By default, the threshold is set at 0.1 radians.

member.name: F:sl.Fusion.sl_GNSSCalibrationParameters.enableTranslationUncertaintyTarget
member.summary: When this parameter is enabled (set to true), the calibration process between GNSS and VIO accounts for the uncertainty in the determined translation, thereby facilitating the calibration termination. The maximum allowable uncertainty is controlled by the 'target_translation_uncertainty' parameter. By default, it is set to false.

member.name: F:sl.Fusion.sl_GNSSCalibrationParameters.targetTranslationUncertainty
member.summary: This parameter defines the target translation uncertainty at which the calibration process between GNSS and VIO terminates. By default, the threshold is set at 10 centimeters (10e-2).

member.name: F:sl.Fusion.sl_GNSSCalibrationParameters.enableReinitialization
member.summary: This initialization parameter determines whether reinitialization should be performed between GNSS and VIO fusion when a significant disparity is detected between GNSS data and the current fusion data. It becomes particularly crucial during prolonged GNSS signal loss scenarios. By default, it is set to true.

member.name: F:sl.Fusion.sl_GNSSCalibrationParameters.gnssVioReinitThreshold
member.summary: This parameter determines the threshold for GNSS/VIO reinitialization. If the fused position deviates beyond the region defined by the product of the GNSS covariance and the gnss_vio_reinit_threshold, a reinitialization will be triggered. By default, it is set to 5.

member.name: F:sl.Fusion.sl_GNSSCalibrationParameters.enableRollingCalibration
member.summary: If this parameter is set to true, the fusion algorithm will used a rough VIO / GNSS calibration at first and then refine it. This allow you to quickly get a fused position. By default, it is set to true.

member.name: F:sl.Fusion.sl_GNSSCalibrationParameters.gnssAntennaPosition
member.summary: Define a transform between the GNSS antenna and the camera system for the VIO / GNSS calibration. Default value is [0,0,0], this position can be refined by the calibration if enabled
